intro: Echinospartum barnadesii, commonly known as the Cape Honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Echinospartum barnadesii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
